## Power of the Prompt - Project Guidelines

### Architecture Mastery Toolkit
This project uses senior-level design patterns documented in `.claudeconfig/`:
- Read `.claudeconfig/instructions.md` for coding standards
- Use patterns from `.claudeconfig/patterns.md`
- Apply templates from `.claudeconfig/templates/`
- Follow diagnostics in `.claudeconfig/diagnostics.md`

### Tech Stack
- Next.js 15 (App Router) with TypeScript
- React 19, Tailwind CSS v4, Radix UI
- Supabase (PostgreSQL + Auth + Realtime)
- Stripe for payments
- Jitsi Meet for video
- Resend for emails
- Anthropic Claude for AI features
- Upstash Redis for caching/rate limiting

### Code Conventions
1. Use existing utilities from `src/lib/` before creating new ones
2. Validate all API inputs with Zod schemas from `src/lib/schemas.ts`
3. Use Pino logger from `src/lib/logger.ts` for structured logging
4. Follow Repository Pattern for data access
5. Apply rate limiting to sensitive API endpoints
6. Respect Row-Level Security (RLS) policies

### File Organization
- API routes: `src/app/api/[feature]/route.ts`
- Components: `src/components/[category]/[Component].tsx`
- Utilities: `src/lib/[utility].ts`
- Types: `src/types/[domain].ts`

### Security Requirements
- Never expose service role keys to client
- Validate all user inputs server-side
- Use parameterized queries (Supabase handles this)
- Check user permissions before sensitive operations
- Rate limit authentication and sensitive endpoints

### Styling
- Use Tailwind CSS utility classes
- Follow existing component patterns in `src/components/ui/`
- Prefer Radix UI primitives for accessible components
- Support dark mode via DarkModeContext
